question: Which genetic susceptibility loci are implicated in irritable bowel syndrome (IBS)?
ideal_answer: There have been six genetic susceptibility loci identified and confirmed for IBS. Implicated genes included NCAM1, CADM2, PHF2/FAM120A, DOCK9, CKAP2/TPTE2P3 and BAG6.

snippets.text: We conducted a genome-wide association study with 53,400 cases and 433,201 controls and replicated significant associations in a 23andMe panel (205,252 cases and 1,384,055 controls). Our study identified and confirmed six genetic susceptibility loci for IBS. Implicated genes included NCAM1, CADM2, PHF2/FAM120A, DOCK9, CKAP2/TPTE2P3 and BAG6.

exact_answer: NCAM1, CADM2, PHF2, FAM120A, DOCK9, CKAP2, TPTE2P3, BAG6
